t: Isaiah 57
Evil Leaders Rebuked
The*pn righteous man perishes, and no man takes it to heart; And*ln devout men are taken away, while no one understands. For*ln the righteous man is taken away from evil,
He*ln enters into peace; They*ln rest in their beds, Each*iln one*i who walked in his upright way.
“But*ln come here, you sons of a sorceress, Offspring*ln of an adulterer and a prostitute.
Against*ln whom do you jest? Against*ln whom do you open wide your mouth And*ln stick out your tongue? Are*ln you not children of rebellion, Offspring*ln of deceit,
Who*iln inflame yourselves among the oaks, Under*ln every luxuriant tree, Who*ln slaughter the children in the ravines, Under*ln the clefts of the crags?

Among*ln the smooth stones*i of the ravine Is*ln your portion, they are your lot; Even*ln to them you have poured out a drink offering, You*ln have made a grain offering. Shall*ln I relent concerning these things?
Upon*ln a high and lofty mountain You*ln have made your bed. You*ln also went up there to offer sacrifice.

Behind*ln the door and the doorpost You*ln have set up your sign; Indeed,*ln far removed from Me, you have uncovered yourself, And*ln have gone up and made your bed wide. And*ln you have made an agreement for yourself with them, You*ln have loved their bed, You*ln have looked on their*i manhood.
You*ln have journeyed to the king with oil And*ln increased your perfumes; You*ln have sent your envoys a great distance And*ln made them*i go down to Sheol.
You*ln were tired out by the length of your road, Yet*iln you did not say, ‘It is hopeless.’ You*ln found renewed strength, Therefore*ln you did not faint.
“Of*ln whom were you worried and fearful When*ln you lied, and did not remember Me Nor*ln give Me*i a thought? Was*ln I not silent even for a long time So*ln you do not fear Me?
I*ln will declare your righteousness and your deeds, But*ln they will not profit you.

When*ln you cry out, let your collection of*i idols*i deliver you. But*ln the wind will carry all of them up, And*iln a breath will take them*i away.*i But*ln he who takes refuge in Me will inherit the land And*ln will possess My holy mountain.”
And*ln it will be said, “Build*ln up, build up, prepare the way, Remove*ln every*i obstacle out of the way of My people.”

For*ln thus says the high and exalted One Who*ln lives forever, whose name is Holy, “I*ln dwell on*i a high and holy place, And*ln also*i with the contrite and lowly of spirit In*ln order to revive the spirit of the lowly And*ln to revive the heart of the contrite.
For*ln I will not contend forever, Nor*ln will I always be angry; For*ln the spirit would grow faint before Me, And*ln the breath of*i those*i whom*i I have made.
Because*ln of the iniquity of his unjust gain I was angry and struck him; I*ln hid My*i face*i and was angry, And*ln he went on turning away, in the way of his heart.
I*ln have seen his ways, but I will heal him; I*ln will lead him and restore comfort to him and to his mourners,
Creating*ln the praise of the lips. Peace,*ln peace to him who is far and to him who is near,” Says*ln the Lord,*s “and I will heal him.”
But*ln the wicked are like the tossing sea, For*ln it cannot be quiet, And*ln its waters toss up refuse and mud.
“There*ln is no peace,” says my God, “for the wicked.”
